election_record.label: New Hampshire 1820 Governor

sub_unit.name: Gilsum
sub_unit.note: The votes from Gilsum were rejected, because the votes "do not state that said votes were declared in open town meeting." Journal of the New Hampshire Senate. 1820. 11.

sub_unit.name: Stoddard
sub_unit.note: The votes from Stoddard were rejected, "it not appearing when the meeting was holden." Journal of the New Hampshire Senate. 1820. 11.

sub_unit.name: Swanzey
sub_unit.note: The votes from Swanzey were rejected, because the votes "do not state that said votes were declared in open town meeting." Journal of the New Hampshire Senate. 1820. 11.

sub_unit.name: Winchester
sub_unit.note: The votes from Winchester were rejected, "it not appearing by the returns that they were true copies of record." Journal of the New Hampshire Senate. 1820. 11.

sub_unit.name: Piercy
sub_unit.note: The votes from Piercy were rejected, "it appearing that four votes were received by the moderator from persons living in Paulsburgh, and included in the above." Journal of the New Hampshire Senate. 1820. 11.

sub_unit.name: Coventry
sub_unit.note: The votes from Coventry were rejected, because the votes "do not state that said votes were declared in open town meeting." Journal of the New Hampshire Senate. 1820. 11.

sub_unit.name: Grafton
sub_unit.note: The votes from Grafton were rejected, because the votes "do not state that said votes were declared in open town meeting." Journal of the New Hampshire Senate. 1820. 11.

sub_unit.name: Lyme
sub_unit.note: The votes from Lyme were rejected, "it not appearing by the returns that they were true copies of record." Journal of the New Hampshire Senate. 1820. 11.

sub_unit.name: Thornton
sub_unit.note: The votes from Thornton were rejected, because the votes "do not state that said votes were declared in open town meeting." Journal of the New Hampshire Senate. 1820. 11.

sub_unit.name: Antrim
sub_unit.note: David L. Morrill received 2 votes as D. Morril and 1 vote as David L.

sub_unit.name: Dunbarton
sub_unit.note: William Hale received 1 vote as William Hall.

sub_unit.name: Brentwood
sub_unit.note: The votes from Brentwood were rejected, "it not appearing by the returns that they were true copies of record." Journal of the New Hampshire Senate. 1820. 11.

sub_unit.name: Northwood
sub_unit.note: The votes from Northwood were rejected, "it not appearing by the returns that they were true copies of record." Journal of the New Hampshire Senate. 1820. 11.

sub_unit.name: Alton
sub_unit.note: The votes from Alton were rejected, because the votes "do not state that said votes were declared in open town meeting." Journal of the New Hampshire Senate. 1820. 11.

sub_unit.name: Barnstead
sub_unit.note: The votes from Brentwood were rejected, "not being returned to the Secretary's office in due season, agreeably to the provisions of the constitution." Journal of the New Hampshire Senate. 1820. 11.

sub_unit.name: Center Harbor
sub_unit.note: The votes from Center Harbor were rejected, "it not appearing by the returns that they were true copies of record." Journal of the New Hampshire Senate. 1820. 11.
